p: Surveillance of the incidence of DENV serotypes and outbreaks is essential to forecast the risk of disease burden and to enable reactive measures such as vector control and social mobilisation [ 14]. Moreover, regionally emerging arboviruses, particularly Zika and Chikungunya [ 15], have complicated dengue diagnosis and surveillance, as symptoms and geographic ranges are similar and serological diagnostics of flaviviruses cross react [ 16].
